body.p:
Couchbase 4.5 is loaded with major enhancements to querying and indexing that boost query performance.
The new "memory=optimized" storage option in 4.5 for global indexes come in addition to the regular storage option that has been previously available in Couchbase Server 4.0 and 4.1. The memory-optimized storage option provides a much faster indexing by performing index maintenance completely in memory. Memory-optimized indexes can process mutations (INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE operations) at a much faster pace and provide much lower latency queries.
Fine-grain array indexes enable the creation of indexes over array elements or attributes nested deep in arrays. Earlier versions supported only coarse-grain array indexes where whole array attribute had to be indexed and queried. Fine-grain indexing achieves more efficient storage of indexed data and subsequently improves flexibility and performance of queries involving selective deep-array elements or attributes.
Full-Text search: Couchbase Full-Text Search (FTS) comes fully integrated with Couchbase Server 4.5. It enables you to create, manage, and query full-text indexes on JSON documents stored in Couchbase Server buckets. This feature empowers developers to easily add full-text search and natural language processing capabilities to their applications. It also simplifies operational complexities involved in installation and administration of external FTS products.
